intro: Melochia interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted melochia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, palmately lobed, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers, which are usually pink to red in color, bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by birds and insects.
